message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $950,000. This is a great deal for both of us. Let me know your thoughts.

Thank you for your offer, Alice. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, given my budget constraints, I am only able to offer $850,000 for the product. I hope this aligns better with your expectations.

Bob, I appreciate your offer. While I value our negotiation, $850,000 is unfortunately below my minimum acceptable price. I'm willing to come down to $900,000. This would still allow me to make a reasonable profit. What do you think?

I understand your position, Alice. I've considered your latest offer, but I'm still unable to meet it at $900,000. I'm willing to pay $875,000 for the product. I hope this proposal is within your acceptable range.

Bob, I understand your constraints. While I am willing to negotiate, I'm still not comfortable with $875,000. How about we split the difference and go with $887,500? This would be a fair compromise for both of us. Let me know if you're open to this.

I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I've carefully considered your proposal and I'm willing to pay $870,000 for the product. I believe this price reflects a fair compromise given the value of the product to me.
